title.label: Great game until the subscriptions and adds took over

content.label: When this game came out, it was honestly an amazing game. It was just a one time buy allowing to you enjoy the game. We already bought the game years ago, so I loaded it up on my phone and it told me that we don’t have an active subscription for it, and I would have to play a limited version with adds. This is very unprofessional, especially considering we already paid for it. I don’t know if it was bought but a new company or something, but I wish the game was how it used to be, where you could just pay upfront and not worry about it
I bought this game years before they turned into ad machines. I love it!  Thank you for not making me put up with ads.  I love Fishdom, too.  I may need to put these games in my will!

Great game but it need more levels. Love the levels that’s in the game. The levels are really challenging but I don’t want to have to download another app to get more levels. They really need to add more challenging levels.

2. Update:I was able to navigate through the various prompts to renew the game.
I like the graphics of this style of game.
Much preferable to cartoon style games 

 1. Original post: My version is a, locked,  permanent 
advertisement loop.
I have been playing this app for like ten years. Still wishing for an update or a similar game to Spider. Such a simple, but awesome , app.
Please up date for the new OS! I want to play this on my new iPhone!

I played this game when I was about 7, and enjoyed it greatly, not even understanding the value of the lore of this game. I replayed it, nearly 8 years later, and I still love it, but now have a better understanding of the “secrets” of the game and the story being told through all the little details. The art style in this game is by far one of my favorites, which makes me sad for the sequel, where the art style is different and more refined. I recommend this game to anyone who wants to experience a sense of exploration with a beautiful art style and settings.

This game is worth more then its value.
This game is fun and relaxing
The music is awesome. I would love to get your music.
I cant wait for a Spider 2 with more abilities or open world or something.
Thanks for this game!

title.label: Just as fun as catching bugs for real!

content.label: This game is about as fun as catching bugs in my house, which is to say, not fun at all. Seriously tho, after the first few levels each room feels like a chore. It's like the family left to give the maid (you) enough time vacuum up all their damned bugs. No thanks.
Was hoping it would be more of a point-and-click adventure game but all you do is spin webs to catch bugs.  Not a bad concept, but nothing great.  Worth a try for the price though.

This game is really fun. Not only is the game play as a spider in an abandoned house a new and unique way to play, but the story in the game is unexpected and very deep. This is a game for people who like mysteries. I loved trying to figure out the mystery of what happened. This game is truly one of a kind.

STILL WAITING FOR THE SEQUEL. AFTER A SOLID 3 YEARS AFTER THE ANNOUNCEMENT THERE WAS GOING TO BE ONE. THE DESCRIPTION STILL SAYS COMING IN 2014, THE SEQUEL. How many times is going to get pushed back, and by how many years!!!!

Eagerly waiting for the sequel!  Probably my favorite game.  But now a little crashy on the iOS8 & iphone 6.  Please update so I can enjoy it all over again!

*****************************************
I'd give it 10 stars if I could! This is not just a game, it is a mysterious adventure. Highly addictive!  4 games come with the app but my favorite is The Secret of Bryce Manor.

It opens the story with hints on how to move. The spider can run, walk, jump, tackle, leap, turn around, and eat. This game bumps up the challenge with each level and holds your interest. It has a very responsive interface. You go up on levels as you work thru the mansion...inside and outside.

There are clues to be found. There are achievements to build, and there is a secret. I have been thru the game once and not yet learned the secret.  I can see that there are different ways to play to get different results.

The more you play, the better you get. There are interesting ways to catch the different bugs. It's got great sound affects and is so realistic.  The mood is all there like a great movie/novel mystery.

It's fun fun fun!!!

The graphics and soundtrack are amazing!!!

It's meant for one player but I've played it with one if my kids by trading off the different levels. We have a blast watching and encouraging each other.

Thank you for this masterpiece!!!

title.label: The game that started it all is still fun

content.label:
This was the first game I played on any iOs device back in 2009, and when I heard that it was finally receiving a sequel, I decided I should replay it.  Amazingly, considering all the innovation in mobile gaming in the last six years, it is still fun to play.  If you are obsessive like I am, it will take you maybe three hours to complete the adventure mode campaign, and there are several more hours worth of content in the other game modes.  I like to break down my reviews into story, visuals, audio and gameplay, so here goes:

Story:  This game is rather story light, expecting the player to create their own version of what happened at the manor based on vague clues and imagination, but it works really nicely.  I felt motivated to track down every secret and open every hidden room.  For what it is, it does this very well.

Visuals:  The hand drawn aesthetic is lovely, even by today's standards, with a lot of care put into each of the backgrounds.  The bugs and spiderwebs don't stand up to time quite as well, but they are not bad enough to be emersion breaking.  It is important to note, however, that the visuals don't quite stand up to the most recent iPhone screens, and it looks really fuzzy if you try and blow it up on an iPad.  They do have an iPad version however.

Audio:  This was one of the first games that put obvious effort into their audio, and I remember being very impressed within it first came out.  That said, by today's standards, it is lacking.  The music is repetitive and has little depth.

Gameplay:  The gameplay is perhaps the weak point of this game.  When it came out, it was amazing, but in 2015, it is lacking.  There are only a few types of "enemy" bugs, and the gameplay breaks down to make webs, chase bugs, eat stuff.  That said, because of the campaign's shortness, it never has a chance to really get boring.

Overall, this game is still worth playing, and it is especially impressive considering its age.
This game is fun, innovative, and beautiful.
Used to be a great game on my iPhone 4s. Now on iPhone 6 it crashes all the time
Crashes at the end of every level thanks to iOS8 update. Love the game. Please fix it.
